538L.name: Topics in Computer Systems - CAUSAL ML

538S.name: Topics in Computer Systems - ACCOUNTABLE SYS

539B.name: Topics in Programming Languages - DEPENDENT TYPES

543.name: Physical User Interface Design and Evaluation

554C.name: Topics in Human-Computer Interaction - HUMAN-CENTRED AI

554X.name: Topics in Human-Computer Interaction - ML & SIGNALS

100.name: Differential Calculus with Applications
100.description: Derivatives of elementary functions. Applications and modelling: graphing, optimization. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
100.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (A score of 80% or higher in BC Pre-calculus 12. High school calculus is strongly recommended.)

101.name: Integral Calculus with Applications
101.description: The definite integral, integration techniques, applications, modelling, infinite series. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
101.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.

110.name: Differential Calculus
110.description: Topics as for MATH 100, but including relevant topics from algebra, geometry, functions, trigonometry, logarithms, and exponentials.
110.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (A grade of 65% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.)

120.name: Honours Differential Calculus
120.description: Limits, derivatives, Mean Value Theorem and applications, elementary functions, optimization, Taylor series, approximation. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
120.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (High-school calculus and one of (a) a score of 95% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12; or (b) permission from the Mathematics Department Head.)

121.name: Honours Integral Calculus
121.description: Definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, techniques and applications of integration, infinite series. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
121.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 120 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 180, MATH 184. (or (c) a score of 5 in AP Calculus AB.)

152.name: Linear Systems
152.description: 2D and 3D geometry, vectors and matrices, eigenvalues and vibration, physical applications. Laboratories demonstrate computer solutions of large systems. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists

180.name: Differential Calculus with Applications
180.description: Topics as for Math 100; intended for students with no previous knowledge of Calculus. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists. Not for credit for students with AP Calculus AB, AP Calculus BC, or a passing score on the UBC-SFU-UVIC-UNBC Calculus Challenge Examination.
180.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (A grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12.)

190.name: Calculus Survey
190.description: Functions, derivatives, integrals, curve sketching growth functions, volume calculations.  Only for credit in the Faculty of Forestry.  Students with credit for MATH 100, 102, 104, 120, 180, or 184 cannot in the same term or later terms obtain credit for MATH 190.
190.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and registration in the B.S.F. or B.Sc.N. programs.)

200.name: Calculus III
200.description: Analytic geometry in 2 and 3 dimensions, partial and directional derivatives, chain rule, maxima and minima, second derivative test, Lagrange multipliers, multiple integrals with applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists.
200.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

210.name: Introduction to Mathematical Computing
210.description: Introduction to numerical computation, computer algebra, mathematical graphics. Primarily for second year students taking a degree in mathematics. One hour laboratory each week.
210.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

215.name: Elementary Differential Equations I
215.description: First-order equations; linear equations; linear systems; Laplace transforms; numerical methods; trajectory analysis of plane nonlinear systems. Applications of these topics will be emphasized. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists.
215.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

217.name: Multivariable and Vector Calculus
217.description: Partial differentiation, extreme values, multiple integration, vector fields, line and surface integrals, the divergence theorem, Green's and Stokes' theorems.  Intended for students in Honours Physics and Engineering Physics. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
217.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in one of PHYS 102, PHYS 108, PHYS 118, PHYS 153, PHYS 158, SCIE 001 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

220.name: Mathematical Proof
220.description: Sets and functions; induction; cardinality;  properties of the real numbers; sequences, series, and limits. Logic, structure, style, and clarity of proofs emphasized throughout.
220.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001 or (b) one of MATH 121, MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

221.name: Matrix Algebra
221.description: Systems of linear equations, operations on matrices, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization of symmetric matrices. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
221.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184 or (b) one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001. (or (c) advanced credit for MATH 100.)

223.name: Linear Algebra
223.description: Matrices, eigenvectors, diagonalization, orthogonality, linear systems, applications. Intended for Honours students. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
223.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) MATH 121 or (b) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001.

226.name: Advanced Calculus I
226.description: Functions of several variables: limits, continuity, differentiability; implicit functions; Taylor's theorem; extrema; Lagrange multipliers; multiple integration, Fubini's theorem; improper integrals. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
226.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 121 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001.

227.name: Advanced Calculus II
227.description: Parametrization of curves and surfaces; line and surface integrals; theorems of Green, Gauss, Stokes; applications to physics and/or introduction to differential forms. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
227.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in MATH 226.

230.name: Marvels of Mathematics
230.description: A variety of topics in mathematics, showcasing its beauty and utility. Intended for a general audience of students whose degrees have no mathematics requirements, but who may be curious about practical and recreational mathematics. Not for credit in the Faculty of Science. Students who obtain UBC credit for any other mathematics course cannot in the same or later years obtain credit for MATH 230.

253.name: Multivariable Calculus
253.description: Partial and directional derivatives; maxima and minima; Lagrange multipliers and second derivative test; multiple integrals and applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
253.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

254.name: Multivariable and Vector Calculus for Mechanical Engineering
254.description: Partial differentiation, extreme values, multiple integration, vector fields, line and surface integrals, the divergence and Stokes' theorems; applications to fluid mechanics: buoyancy, hydrostatic force, pipe flow, drag; applications to thermodynamics: work, entropy, heat transfer; numerical methods. Emphasis on mechanical engineering applications.
254.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

255.name: Ordinary Differential Equations
255.description: Review of linear systems; nonlinear equations and applications; phase plane analysis; Laplace transforms; numerical methods. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
255.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

256.name: Differential Equations
256.description: Linear ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms, Fourier series and separation of variables for linear partial differential equations. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists.
256.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

257.name: Partial Differential Equations
257.description: Introduction to partial differential equations; Fourier series; the heat, wave and potential equations; boundary-value problems; numerical methods. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
257.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

258.name: Differential Equations for Mechanical Engineering
258.description: First-order equations; linear equations; linear systems; Laplace transforms; trajectory analysis of plane nonlinear systems; translational and rotational vibrations; applications to RLC circuit analysis; numerical and graphical methods. Emphasis on mechanical engineering applications.
258.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

264.name: Vector Calculus for Electrical Engineering
264.description: Divergence, gradient, curl, theorems of Gauss and Stokes. Applications to Electrostatics and Magnetostatics. MATH 264 content is strongly coupled to BMEG 220 and ELEC 211 with topics and student evaluations weighted accordingly.
264.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

300.name: Introduction to Complex Variables
300.description: Functions of a complex variable, Cauchy-Riemann equations, elementary functions, Cauchy's theorem and contour integration, Laurent series, poles and residues. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
300.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

301.name: Applied Analysis
301.description: Integrals involving multi-valued functions, conformal mapping and applications, analytic continuation, Laplace and Fourier transforms.
301.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 300, MATH 305 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

302.name: Introduction to Probability
302.description: Basic notions of probability, random variables, expectation and conditional expectation, limit theorems.   Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
302.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

303.name: Introduction to Stochastic Processes
303.description: Discrete-time Markov chains, Poisson processes, continuous time Markov chains, renewal theory. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists

305.name: Applied Complex Analysis
305.description: Functions of a complex variable, Cauchy-Riemann equations, contour integration, Laurent series, residues, integrals of multi-valued functions, Fourier transforms. See Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
305.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

307.name: Applied Linear Algebra
307.description: Applications of linear algebra to problems in science and engineering; use of computer algebra systems for solving problems in linear algebra.
307.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.

308.name: Euclidean Geometry
308.description: Classical plane geometry, solid geometry, spherical trigonometry, polyhedra, linear and affine transformations. Linear algebra proofs are used. It is suggested that MATH 307 be taken concurrently.
308.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121;  or (b) MATH 223.

310.name: Abstract Linear Algebra
310.description: Linear spaces, duality, linear mappings, matrices, determinant and trace, spectral theory, Euclidean structure. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
310.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121.

312.name: Introduction to Number Theory
312.description: Euclidean algorithm, congruences, Fermat's theorem, applications. Some diophantine equations. Distribution of the prime numbers. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
312.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. (and 9 additional credits of mathematics courses.)

313.name: Topics in Number Theory
313.description: Topics chosen by the instructor. These might include: division algorithms, group theory, continued fractions, primality testing, factoring.  Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists.

316.name: Elementary Differential Equations II
316.description: Power series methods (ordinary and regular singular points, Bessel's equation); boundary value problems and separation of variables (Fourier series and other orthogonal series), applications to the vibrating string, heat flow, potentials. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
316.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

317.name: Calculus IV
317.description: Parametrizations, inverse and implicit functions, integrals with respect to length and area; grad, div, and curl, theorems of Green, Gauss, and Stokes. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
317.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 226, MATH 253. (One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 is recommended.)

318.name: Probability with Physical Applications
318.description: Random variables, discrete and continuous distributions. Random walk, Markov chains, Monte Carlo methods. Characteristic functions, limit laws. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
318.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

319.name: Introduction to Real Analysis
319.description: Ideas and methods of real analysis and their application. Countability and topology of the reals; convergence, continuity and differentiability of functions; metric spaces. Please consult the Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
319.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 220 or (b) a score of 55% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 226.

320.name: Real Variables I
320.description: The real number system; real Euclidean n-space; open, closed, compact, and connected sets; Bolzano-Weierstrass theorem; sequences and series. Continuity and uniform continuity. Differentiability and mean-value theorems.
320.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 226 or (b) one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.

321.name: Real Variables II
321.description: The Riemann or Riemann-Stieltjes integrals. Sequences and series of functions, uniform convergence. Approximation of continuous functions by polynomials. Fourier series. Functions from Rm to Rn, inverse and implicit function theorems.

322.name: Introduction to Group Theory
322.description: Groups, cosets, homomorphisms, group actions, p-groups, Sylow theorems, composition series, finitely generated Abelian groups.
322.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 310 or (b) one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.

323.name: Introduction to Rings and Modules
323.description: Rings, ideals, unique factorization, Euclidean rings, fields, polynomial rings, modules; structure theory of modules over a principal ideal domain.

335.name: Introduction to Mathematics
335.description: Intensive course with required tutorial. Combinatorics, probability, geometry and elementary number theory. Not for credit in the Faculty of Science. Students who obtain credit at UBC for any other mathematics course cannot in the same or later years obtain credit for MATH 335. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists

340.name: Introduction to Linear Programming
340.description: Linear programming problems, dual problems, the simplex algorithm, solution of primal and dual problems, sensitivity analysis. Additional topics chosen from: Karmarkar's algorithm, non-linear programming, game theory, applications.
340.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

341.name: Introduction to Discrete Mathematics
341.description: Introduction to ideas and methods of discrete mathematics and their application.
341.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121.

342.name: Algebra and Coding Theory
342.description: Error-correcting codes via abstract and linear algebra.  Emphasis on proofs and computation.  Finite fields, Hamming distance and error-correction, upper and lower bounds on the size of a code, linear codes, groups and cosets, encoding and decoding schemes.
342.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121;  or (b) MATH 223.

344.name: Mathematical Game Theory
344.description: Introduction to mathematical game theory and its applications.
344.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121;  or (b) MATH 223.

345.name: Applied Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
345.description: Phase plane methods, bifurcation and stability theory, limit-cycle behavior and chaos for nonlinear differential equations with applications to the sciences.  Assignments involve the use of computers.
345.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

360.name: Introduction to Mathematical Modelling
360.description: Construction and evaluation of deterministic, stochastic, and data-driven models. Software-assisted simulations and numerical solutions involving ordinary differential equations, stochastic processes, and basic machine learning algorithms. Examples from science, engineering, and economics.
360.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of MATH 210, CPSC 203, CPSC 210 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.

400.name: Applied Partial Differential Equations
400.description: Separation of variables, first order equations, Sturm-Liouville theory, integral transform methods.
400.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 300, MATH 305 and one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

401.name: Green's Functions and Variational Methods
401.description: Green's functions for partial differential equations. Calculus of variations. Eigenfunction expansions. Rayleigh-Ritz and finite element methods.  See Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
401.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.

402.name: Calculus of Variations
402.description: Classical variational problems; necessary conditions of Euler, Weierstrass, Legendre, and Jacobi; Erdmann corner conditions, transversality, convex Lagrangians, fields of extremals, sufficient conditions for optimality, numerical methods; applications to classical mechanics, engineering and economics. Recommended pre-requisites: a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 301, MATH 320.

404.name: Harmonic Analysis I
404.description: Harmonic analysis on Euclidean spaces, with applications to number theory, partial differential equations and geometric measure theory.
404.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     MATH 300 and a score of 68% or higher in MATH 321.

405.name: Numerical Methods for Differential Equations
405.description: Interpolation, numerical integration, numerical solution of ordinary and partial differential equations. Practical computational methods emphasized and basic theory developed through simple models. See Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
405.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.

406.name: Variational and Approximate Methods in Applied Mathematics
406.description: Variational and Green's function methods for ordinary and partial differential equations, introduction to finite difference, finite element and boundary element methods.  See Faculty of Science Credit exclusion list: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
406.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 307, CPSC 302 and either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.

418.name: Probability
418.description: Probability spaces, random variables, distributions, expectation, conditional probabilities, convergence of random variables, generating and characteristic functions, weak and strong laws of large numbers, central limit theorem.
418.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in MATH 321.

419.name: Stochastic Processes
419.description: Random walks, Markov chains, branching processes, Poisson processes, continuous time Markov chains, martingales, Brownian motion.

420.name: Real Analysis I
420.description: Sigma-algebras, Lebesgue measure, Borel measures, measurable functions, integration, convergence theorems, Lp spaces, Holder and Minkowski inequalities, Lebesgue and/or Radon-Nikodym differentiation.
420.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in MATH 321.

421.name: Real Analysis II
421.description: Banach spaces, linear operators, bounded and compact operators, strong, weak, and weak* topology.  Hahn-Banach, open mapping, and closed graph theorems.  Hilbert spaces, symmetric and self-adjoint operators, spectral theory for bounded operators.

422.name: Fields and Galois Theory
422.description: Field extensions, the Galois correspondence, finite fields, insolvability in radicals, ruler and compass constructions, additional topics chosen by instructor.

423.name: Commutative Algebra
423.description: Commutative algebra; homological algebra or representation theory of finite groups.
423.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     MATH 323 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 412, MATH 422.

425.name: Introduction to Modern Differential Geometry
425.description: Smooth manifolds, smooth maps, immersions and submersions, vector fields, vector bundles, tangent and cotangent bundles, tensors and differential forms, orientation of manifolds, integration of forms, and selected topics.
425.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 217, MATH 227, MATH 254, MATH 264, MATH 317 and one of MATH 319, MATH 320.

426.name: Introduction to Topology
426.description: General topology, combinatorial topology, fundamental group and covering spaces, topics chosen by the instructor.
426.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in all of MATH 321, MATH 322.

427.name: Topics in Topology
427.description: Homology theory, homotopy theory, manifolds, and other topics chosen by the instructor.

437.name: Number Theory
437.description: Divisibility, congruences, Diophantine equations, arithmetic functions, quadratic reciprocity, advanced topics. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists.

440.name: Complex Analysis
440.description: The residue theorem, the argument principle, conformal mapping, the maximum modulus principle, harmonic functions, representation of functions by integrals, series, and products. Other topics at the discretion of the instructor.
440.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     MATH 300 and a score of 68% or higher in MATH 320.

441.name: Mathematical Modelling: Discrete Optimization Problems
441.description: Formulation of real-world optimization problems using techniques such as linear programming, network flows, integer programming, dynamic programming. Solution by appropriate software.

442.name: Graphs and Networks
442.description: Graph theory, emphasizing trees, tree growing algorithms, and proof techniques. Other topics chosen from shortest paths, maximum flows, minimum cost flows, matchings, and graph colouring.
442.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (3rd year standing and one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226 or CPSC 221.)

443.name: Graph Theory
443.description: Introductory course in mostly non-algorithmic topics including: planarity and Kuratowski's theorem, graph colouring, graph minors, random graphs, cycles in graphs, Ramsey theory, extremal graph theory. Proofs emphasized. Intended for Honours students.
443.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. (And 6 credits of MATH numbered 300 or above.)

444.name: Mathematical Research and Writing
444.description: Current research topics in pure and applied mathematics are explored at the undergraduate level.  Technical communication and research skills are developed.
444.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 220, MATH 226. (and 6 credits of MATH courses numbered 300 or higher.)

446.name: Topics in the History of Mathematics I
446.description: Historical development of concepts and techniques in areas chosen from Geometry, Number Theory, Algebra, Calculus, Probability, Analysis. The focus is on historically significant writings of important contributors and on famous problems of Mathematics.

448A.name: Directed Studies in Mathematics - DIRECTED STUDIES
448A.description: Introduction to the methods of mathematical research through an exploration of a mathematical topic under the supervision of a faculty member.  Written report required.
448A.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third- or fourth-year standing and permission of the Department Head.)

448B.name: Directed Studies in Mathematics - DIRECTED STUDIES
448B.description: Introduction to the methods of mathematical research through an exploration of a mathematical topic under the supervision of a faculty member.  Written report required.
448B.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third- or fourth-year standing and permission of the Department Head.)

449C.name: Honours Reading - HONOURS READING
449C.description: Independent reading by Honours students in Mathematics under the direction of a faculty member. Written report required.

449F.name: Honours Reading - HONOURS READING
449F.description: Independent reading by Honours students in Mathematics under the direction of a faculty member. Written report required.

450.name: Asymptotic and Perturbation Methods
450.description: Asymptotic expansions. Asymptotic evaluation of integrals; WKBJ methods. Regular and singular expansions. Boundary layer theory; matched asymptotic expansions. Multiple scale techniques.

521.name: Numerical Analysis of Partial Differential Equations

549A.name: Thesis for Master's Degree - MASTERS THESIS

549B.name: Thesis for Master's Degree - MASTERS THESIS

552.name: Introduction to Dynamical Systems
552.description: Ideas, methods and applications of bifurcation theory and dynamical systems: differential and difference equations, local bifurcations, perturbation methods, chaos. Recommended pre-requisites: one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256 and one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316.

564.name: Evolutionary Dynamics
564.description: Mathematical models of evolution and evolutionary game theory. Stochastic dynamics in finite populations, dynamics in spatially structured populations, and adaptive dynamics. Applications include the origin of species and the problem of cooperation.

590.name: Graduate Seminar
590.description: Presentation and discussion of recent results in the mathematical literature.

590A.name: Graduate Seminar - GRADUATE SEMINAR
590A.description: Presentation and discussion of recent results in the mathematical literature.

590B.name: Graduate Seminar - GRADUATE SEMINAR
590B.description: Presentation and discussion of recent results in the mathematical literature.

592A.name: Topics in Automorphic Forms - AUTOMORPHIC FORM

605E.name: Topics in Applied Mathematics - TPC APPLIED MATH

605F.name: Topics in Applied Mathematics - TPC APPLIED MATH

606D.name: Topics in Differential Equations - TPCS DIFRNTL EQU

607E.name: Topics in Numerical Analysis - TPCS NUMERIC ANL

610D.name: Topics in Pure Mathematics - TOPICS PURE MATH

613E.name: Topics in Number Theory - NUMBER THEORY

615A.name: Topics in Algebraic Geometry - ALGEBRAIC GEOMET

200.name: Elementary Statistics for Applications
200.description: Classical, nonparametric, and robust inferences about means, variances, and analysis of variance, using computers. Emphasis on problem formulation, assumptions, and interpretation. See the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion Lists: https://vancouver.calendar.ubc.ca/faculties-colleges-and-schools/faculty-science/bachelor-science/credit-exclusion-lists
200.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

201.name: Statistical Inference for Data Science
201.description: Classical and simulation-based techniques for estimation and hypothesis testing, including inference for means and proportions. Emphasis on case studies and real data sets, as well as reproducible and transparent workflows when writing computer scripts for analysis and reports.

203.name: Statistical Methods
203.description: Organizing, displaying and summarizing data. Inference estimation and testing for elementary probability models. Not for credit towards a B.Sc. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar.)

251.name: Elementary Statistics
251.description: Probability, discrete and continuous random variables, joint probability distributions, estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, analysis of variance, goodness of fit. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar).
251.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.

300.name: Intermediate Statistics for Applications
300.description: Further topics in statistical inference, including parametric and non-parametric methods, goodness-of-fit methods, analysis of variance and covariance, regression analysis, categorical data analysis, experimental designs, time series, model fitting, and statistical computing.
300.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of STAT 200, STAT 203, STAT 241, STAT 251, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, KIN  206, LFS  252, POLI 380, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366.

301.name: Statistical Modelling for Data Science
301.description: Data analysis using statistical models and algorithms (e.g., linear and logistic regression, peeking, bandit, and variable selection algorithms) in case studies from different disciplines. Generative versus out-of-sample predictive models. Reproducible and transparent workflows for computer scripts and reports.
301.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     STAT 201 and one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184, SCIE 001.

302.name: Introduction to Probability
302.description: Basic notions of probability, random variables, expectation and conditional expectation, limit theorems. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar.)
302.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 200, MATH 226, MATH 217, MATH 253, MATH 254.

305.name: Introduction to Statistical Inference
305.description: Review of probability theory. Sampling distribution theory, large sample theory and methods of estimation and hypothesis testing, including maximum likelihood estimation, likelihood ratio testing and confidence interval construction.
305.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) one of STAT 200, STAT 203, BIOL 300, STAT 241, STAT 251, COMM 291, ECON 325, FRST 231, PSYC 218, PSYC 366 and one of MATH 302, STAT 302;  or (b) a score of 65% or higher in one of MATH 302, STAT 302. (The Department recommends that students meet the prerequisite through option (a).)

306.name: Finding Relationships in Data
306.description: Modelling a response (output) variable as a function of several explanatory (input) variables:  multiple regression for a continuous response, logistic regression for a binary response, and log-linear models for count data.  Finding low-dimensional structure:  principal components analysis.  Cluster analysis.  (Consult the Credit Exclusion List within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar).
306.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 251, STAT 300, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366 and one of MATH 302, STAT 302.

344.name: Sample Surveys
344.description: Planning and practice of sample surveys. Random sampling, bias and variance, unequal probability sampling, systematic, multistage and stratified sampling, ratio and regression estimators, post-stratification, establishing a frame, pretesting, pilot studies, nonresponse and additional topics.
344.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 251, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366.

398.name: Co-operative Work Placement I
398.description: Work experience in an industrial research setting. Normally taken during Winter Session of third year. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Statistics.
398.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Registration in Statistics Honours or Major Program.)

399.name: Co-operative Work Placement II
399.description: Work experience in an industrial research setting. Normally taken during Summer Session following third year. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Statistics.

404.name: Design and Analysis of Experiments
404.description: Theory and application of analysis of variance for standard experimental designs, including blocked, nested, factorial and split plot designs. Fixed and random effects, multiple comparisons, analysis of covariance. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar).

406.name: Methods for Statistical Learning
406.description: Flexible, data-adaptive methods for regression and classification models; regression smoothers; penalty methods; assessing accuracy of prediction; model selection; robustness; classification and regression trees; nearest-neighbour methods; neural networks; model averaging and ensembles; computational time and visualization for large data sets.

443.name: Time Series and Forecasting
443.description: Trend and seasonality, autocorrelation, stationarity, stochastic models, exponential smoothing, Holt-Winters methods, Box-Jenkins approach, frequency domain analysis.
443.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 302, MATH 318, STAT 302 and one of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 251, STAT 300, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, POLI 380, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366.

447C.name: Special Topics in Statistics - BAYESIAN STATS
447C.description: Students should consult the Statistics Department for the particular topics offered in a given year.

449A.name: Statistics Honours Project - STAT HNRS PROJCT
449A.description: A research project, undertaken under the supervision of a faculty member, resulting in a written report.
449A.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Open to fourth year students enrolled in a Statistics Honours specialization. Permission of the Undergraduate Advisor and supervising faculty member is required.)

449B.name: Statistics Honours Project - STAT HNRS PROJCT
449B.description: A research project, undertaken under the supervision of a faculty member, resulting in a written report.
449B.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Open to fourth year students enrolled in a Statistics Honours specialization. Permission of the Undergraduate Advisor and supervising faculty member is required.)

450.name: Case Studies in Statistics
450.description: Readings and projects in areas of current statistical application including environmental science, industrial statistics, official statistics, actuarial statistics, and medical statistics.

460.name: Statistical Inference I
460.description: Statistical models and their properties, estimation methods, properties of point and interval estimation, likelihood, Bayesian inference. Intended for Honours students.
460.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     All of MATH 320, STAT 305 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

461.name: Statistical Inference II
461.description: Hypothesis testing and model selection in modern statistics, confidence regions, multiple testing, model comparison criteria. Intended for Honours students.

498.name: Co-operative Work Placement III
498.description: Work experience in an industrial research setting. Normally taken during Summer Session following fourth year. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Statistics.

499.name: Co-operative Work Placement IV
499.description: Work experience in an industrial research setting. Normally taken during Term 1 of Winter Session of fifth year. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Statistics.

520P.name: Topics in Bayesian Analysis and Decision Theory - BAYESOPT

521B.name: Topics in Multivariate Analysis - FND MULTIVAR ANL

536E.name: Statistical Theory for the Design and Analysis of Clinical Studies - BIOSTAT METHODS

536F.name: Statistical Theory for the Design and Analysis of Clinical Studies - BIOSTAT PART 2

538A.name: Generalized Linear Models - GEN LINEAR MODLS

540.name: Statistical Methods for High Dimensional Biology

545A.name: Exploratory Data Analysis - DATA ANALYSIS I

545B.name: Exploratory Data Analysis - DATA ANALYSIS II

547C.name: Topics in Statistics - PROB OF STATS
547C.description: Students should consult the Statistics Department for the particular advanced topics offered in a given year.

547M.name: Topics in Statistics - STAT OF EXTREMES
547M.description: Students should consult the Statistics Department for the particular advanced topics offered in a given year.

547T.name: Topics in Statistics - REPLICABILITY
547T.description: Students should consult the Statistics Department for the particular advanced topics offered in a given year.

548A.name: Directed Studies in Statistics - DIRECTED STUDIES

548B.name: Directed Studies in Statistics - DIRECTED STUDIES

549A.name: Thesis for Master's Degree - THESIS FOR MSTRS

560.name: Statistical Theory I
560.description: Credit will not be given for both STAT 460 and STAT 560.

598.name: Co-operative Work Placement I
598.description: Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative M.Sc. Education Program in Statistics.

599.name: Co-operative Work Placement II
599.description: Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative M.Sc. Education Program in Statistics.

211.name: Computing Systems I
211.description: Boolean algebra; combinational and sequential circuits; organization and operation of microcomputers, memory addressing modes, representation of information, instruction sets, machine and assembly language programming, systems programs, I/O structures, I/O interfacing and I/O programming, introduction to digital system design using microcomputers. Credit will be granted for only one of CPEN 211, CPEN 312, EECE 256, EECE 259 or EECE 355.

212.name: Computing Systems II
212.description: Computer architecture and the hardware- software interface: pipelining; caches; virtual memory; memory management; linking; concurrency; introduction to compilers.
212.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPEN 211 and one of CPEN 221, CPEN 223, CPSC 259.

221.name: Software Construction I
221.description: Design, implementation, reasoning about software systems: abstraction and specification of software, testing, verification, abstract data types, object-oriented design, type hierarchies, concurrent software design.

221A.name: Software Construction I - SFTWR CONST I
221A.description: Design, implementation, reasoning about software systems: abstraction and specification of software, testing, verification, abstract data types, object-oriented design, type hierarchies, concurrent software design.

221B.name: Software Construction I - SFTWR CONST I
221B.description: Design, implementation, reasoning about software systems: abstraction and specification of software, testing, verification, abstract data types, object-oriented design, type hierarchies, concurrent software design.

223.name: Software Design for Engineers I
223.description: Introduction to robust software design: static typing, procedural specifications, unit testing, black-box and white-box tests, user- defined data types (representations, invariants, abstraction functions), data abstractions, communicating design (e.g., UML).

281.name: Technical Communication
281.description: Written and oral communication in engineering. Technical description, report preparation, business correspondence, and oral presentation of technical material. Restricted to students in second year of Electrical and Computer Engineering programs. Credit will be granted for only one of ELEC 281, CPEN 281, BMEG 201 or APSC 201.
281.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150.

311.name: Digital Systems Design
311.description: Advanced combinational and sequential electronic system design. Hardware specification, modelling, and simulation using hardware description languages (HDLs) and CAD tools. Design with programmable logic including FPGA's. Applications include complex state machines, microcontrollers, arithmetic circuits, and interface units.

312.name: Digital Systems and Microcomputers
312.description: Data representation in digital computers; boolean algebra; the design and optimization and implementation of combinatorial and sequential circuits; modern digital circuit technologies; memory and programmable logic devices; organization and operation of microcomputers; data/address bus organization; input-output interfacing. Credit will be granted for only one of CPEN 312, CPEN 211. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading
312.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of ELEC 201, ELEC 204, ELEC 203, MECH 221.

321.name: Software Engineering
321.description: Engineering practices for the development of non-trivial software-intensive systems including requirements specification, software architecture, implementation, verification, and maintenance. Iterative development. Recognized standards, guidelines, and models. Credit will only be granted for only one of CPSC 310, CPEN 321.

322.name: Software Construction II
322.description: Contemporary concepts and techniques for developing interactive software applications: client-server architectures; session-oriented systems; security and scalability; models of application deployment.

331.name: Operating Systems
331.description: Operating systems, their design and their implementation. Process concurrency, synchronization, communication and scheduling. Device drivers, memory management, virtual memory, file systems, networking and security.
331.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 261, CPEN 212 and CPEN 221.

333A.name: Software Design for Engineers II - SFTWR DSN ENG II
333A.description: Use of operating systems abstractions; real-time systems; principles of concurrent and multi-threaded programming; information structures; introduction to object oriented analysis; design, and modelling using UML; software testing.

333B.name: Software Design for Engineers II - SFTWR DSN ENG II
333B.description: Use of operating systems abstractions; real-time systems; principles of concurrent and multi-threaded programming; information structures; introduction to object oriented analysis; design, and modelling using UML; software testing.

355.name: Machine Learning with Engineering Applications
355.description: Foundations and concepts of data science and machine learning with applications to engineering problems.
355.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 318, MATH 302, STAT 302, STAT 321, ELEC 321 and one of CPEN 221, CPEN 223, CPSC 259.

400P.name: Topics in Computer Engineering - PROGRAM ANALYSIS
400P.description: Lectures or projects on subjects of current interest.

400Q.name: Topics in Computer Engineering - QUANTUM COMPUTNG
400Q.description: Lectures or projects on subjects of current interest.

411.name: Computer Architecture
411.description: Modern processors, GPUs, and memory hierarchies; quantitative principles and instruction set design; pipelining, superscalar issue, out-of-order execution, branch prediction and speculation; memory hierarchies, caches, virtual addressing, prefetching, coherence, and consistency; multicores, VLIW, on-chip networks, and other advanced architectures. Credit will be granted for only one of CPSC 313, CPEN 411. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.
411.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPEN 212, CPEN 311, CPEN 312.

412.name: Microcomputer Systems Design
412.description: Microprocessor and system buses; advanced I/O methods; priority interrupts; event/exception handling; serial I/O; computer networking; memory system design; interaction of hardware and software, microprocessor comparison, testability issues, safety critical systems.
412.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPEN 311 and one of CPEN 211, CPEN 312.

431.name: Design of Distributed Software Applications
431.description: Communications, processes, naming, synchronization, consistency and replication, fault tolerance, middleware, and security technologies for distributed applications.
431.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPEN 331, CPSC 313 and one of CPEN 221, CPSC 210.

441.name: Human Computer Interfaces in Engineering Design
441.description: Practical issues for interfaces for modern software. Task analysis, user modelling, usability engineering, representations, metaphors, prototyping tools. Applications: interactive multimedia systems, engineering, scientific visualization, engineering design.
441.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 260, CPSC 221 and one of CPEN 221, CPSC 210, CPEN 333.

442.name: Introduction to Cybersecurity
442.description: Security risks, threats, and vulnerabilities from technical perspectives; cryptography; software and web security; access control, assurance, accountability; usable privacy and security; engineering of secure systems; cryptocurrencies.
442.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPEN 333, CPEN 331, CPSC 313.

455.name: Deep Learning
455.description: Fundamentals of deep learning, including architectures (e.g., MLPs, CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, and GNNs) and learning algorithms under different paradigms (supervised / unsupervised / reinforcement learning). Emphasis on design principles and motivating applications.
455.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 318, MATH 302, STAT 302, STAT 321, ELEC 321 and one of CPEN 221, CPEN 223, CPSC 259.

481.name: Economic Analysis of Engineering Projects
481.description: Time-money relationships; economic analysis of alternatives including the effects of interest rates, inflation, depreciation, taxation and uncertainty; cost estimation and budgeting; financial analysis of engineering operations.

491F.name: Computer Engineering Capstone Design Project - CAPSTONE DSGN A
491F.description: Design, analysis, and implementation of solutions in response to a real-world computer engineering problem, provided by industry, research laboratories, or other suitable entities. Includes coverage of topics such as project management.
491F.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     All of CPEN 331, CPSC 320 and one of CPEN 311, CPEN 322;  and one of CPEN 291, CPEN 391.

491W.name: Computer Engineering Capstone Design Project - CAPSTONE DSGN A
491W.description: Design, analysis, and implementation of solutions in response to a real-world computer engineering problem, provided by industry, research laboratories, or other suitable entities. Includes coverage of topics such as project management.
491W.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     All of CPEN 331, CPSC 320 and one of CPEN 311, CPEN 322;  and one of CPEN 291, CPEN 391.

497F.name: Research Experience in Computer Engineering - UGRD RSCH EXP
497F.description: Directed research experience. Communication of research ideas. Pass/Fail.

497W.name: Research Experience in Computer Engineering - UGRD RSCH EXP
497W.description: Directed research experience. Communication of research ideas. Pass/Fail.

499A.name: Undergraduate Thesis - UNDERGRAD THESIS
499A.description: Project in electrical engineering or computer engineering involving design, experimental and/or computer simulation work as selected from topics supplied by faculty members. An individual project thesis is to be prepared according to specifications available from the departmental office.

499B.name: Undergraduate Thesis - UNDERGRAD THESIS
499B.description: Project in electrical engineering or computer engineering involving design, experimental and/or computer simulation work as selected from topics supplied by faculty members. An individual project thesis is to be prepared according to specifications available from the departmental office.

502.name: Architecture for Learning Systems
502.description: Credit will only be given for one of CPEN 502 or EECE 592.

511.name: Advanced Computer Architecture
511.description: Credit will only be given for one of CPEN 511 or EECE 527.

522.name: Software Verification and Testing
522.description: Credit will only be given for one of CPEN 522 or EECE 514.

542.name: Cybersecurity
542.description: Credit will only be given for one of CPEN 542 or EECE 512.

200.name: Introduction to Cognitive Systems
200.description: Interdisciplinary examination of human mental processes and how these are mediated by the brain. Will draw on cognitive psychology, linguistics, cognitive neuroscience, philosophy, artificial intelligence.
200.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (second-year standing in the Faculty of Arts or Science.)

300.name: Understanding and Designing Cognitive Systems
300.description: Theory and methods for integrating diverse disciplinary content in cognitive systems.

303.name: Research Methods in Cognitive Systems
303.description: Examination and comparison of the research methodologies of different disciplines relevant to cognitive systems.

401.name: Seminar in Cognitive Systems
401.description: Interdisciplinary seminar integrating theory, methods, and current research topics.

402.name: Research in Cognitive Systems
402.description: Supervised research project in a Cognitive Systems-related laboratory.

100.name: Introduction to Data Science
100.description: Use of data science tools to summarize, visualize, and analyze data. Sensible workflows and clear interpretations are emphasized.

310.name: Reproducible and Trustworthy Workflows for Data Science
310.description: Data science methods to automate the running and testing of code and analytic reports, manage data analysis software dependencies, package and deploy software for data analysis, and collaborate with others using version control.
310.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     DSCI 100 and either (a) one of CPSC 203, CPSC 210, CPEN 221 or (b) one of MATH 210, ECON 323 and one of CPSC 107, CPSC 110.

320.name: Visualization for Data Science
320.description: Analysis, design, and implementation of static and interactive visual representations; visualization literacy; data communication; exploratory Data Analysis; application of theoretical principles to visualization development.
320.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     STAT 201 and one of CPSC 203, CPSC 210, CPEN 221.

430.name: Fairness, Accountability, Transparency and Ethics (FATE) in Data Science
430.description: Ethical application of data science and machine learning algorithms. Application of ethical theories in real-world case studies. Data ownership, collection, and validity. Algorithm auditing, fairness and transparency. Reducing unfairness in algorithms. Deployment of predictive models and dissemination of results.
430.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 330, CPSC 340, STAT 301, STAT 406.

511.name: Programming for Data Science
511.description: Pseudo-code. Program design and structure. Flow control. Iteration. Lists (arrays). Functions. File I/O. Classes, objects, methods, and libraries.

512.name: Algorithms and Data Structures
512.description: Basic algorithms. Recursion. Data structures including linked lists, queues, stacks, trees, graphs, and hash tables. Searching and sorting. Introduction to complexity including Big-O notation, efficiency, and scalability.

513.name: Databases and Data Retrieval
513.description: Relational schemas. SQL queries. Database programming using embedded SQL. XML and XQuery.

521.name: Computing Platforms for Data Science
521.description: Introduction to software, shells, tools, and file systems for use in the Data Science program. Installation, configuration, and use of statistical and programming software including Integrated Development Environments (IDEs). Problem resolution skills.

522.name: Data Science Workflows
522.description: Interactive and non-interactive data analysis. Scripting. Dynamic reporting. Reproducibility. Project and file management. Version control. Automated workflows.

523.name: Programming for Data Manipulation
523.description: Program design and data manipulation using industry-standard software tools designed for statistical work. Organizing, filtering, sorting, grouping, reformatting, converting, and cleaning data to prepare it for further analysis. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading.

524.name: Collaborative Software Development
524.description: Software life cycle. Unit testing. Continuous integration. Submission to a relevant repository for distribution. Packaging for installation and use by others. Software licenses. Classes and abstraction.

525.name: Web and Cloud Computing
525.description: Networks and the Internet, scraping data, APIs, cloud computing, Web services for scalable computing, Web hosting, Web publication platforms, introduction to parallel computing.

531.name: Data Visualization I
531.description: Descriptive plots using statistical and programming software. Basics, mechanics, and principles of data visualization.

532.name: Data Visualization II
532.description: Interactive visualization, design choices, dynamic change over time, multiple views, data reduction, dealing with complexity.

541.name: Privacy, Ethics, and Security
541.description: Privacy and data. Ethics boards, legal issues, licensing. Physical and logical data security, social engineering. Encryption, data anonymization, privacy-preserving techniques. Case studies.

542.name: Communication and Argumentation
542.description: Claims, reasons, and evidence. Strengths and weaknesses of models. Effective oral and written presentation of scientific results, including interpretation of data and recognition of assumptions, bias, validity, and reliability. Citations, references, and peer-review.

551.name: Descriptive Statistics and Probability for Data Science
551.description: Descriptive statistics including measures of location and spread. Random variables, distributions, and parameters. Categorical variables. Uncertainty. Missing data.

552.name: Statistical Inference and Computation I
552.description: Random variables, parameters, observed data, statistics (distinctions and connections). Estimation: point and interval. Two-group comparisons, frequentist version. Simulation-based approaches.

553.name: Statistical Inference and Computation II
553.description: Multiple hypothesis testing, false discovery rate. Two-group comparisons, Bayesian paradigm.

554.name: Experimentation and Causal Inference
554.description: Randomization. A/B testing. Blocked designs. Orthogonality. Batch effects, confounding. Causality. Contemporary examples. Simulations.

561.name: Regression I
561.description: Linear models: continuous response; one or more categorical covariates and/or one or more continuous covariates.

562.name: Regression II
562.description: Non-parametric regression and smoothing. Data-driven parameter selection. Robust regression. Mixed effects.

563.name: Unsupervised Learning
563.description: Unsupervised learning. K-means/medoids. Model-based clustering. Expectation-maximization algorithm. Hierarchical clustering. Dimension reduction. Matrix decomposition. Heatmaps, contour plots, dendograms.

571.name: Supervised Learning I
571.description: Decision trees. k-th nearest neighbour classifiers. Naive Bayes classifiers. Logistic regression.

572.name: Supervised Learning II
572.description: Support Vector Machines. Random Forests. Ensemble Classifiers. Graphical models.

573.name: Feature and Model Selection
573.description: Performance of a classification model. Generalization error, overfitting of training data. Shrinkage, feature selection, Akaike Information Criterion, Bayesian Information Criterion. k-fold cross validation. Bootstrapping. Receiver Operating Characteristic curve. Elastic nets, regularization.

574.name: Spatial and Temporal Models
574.description: Time series. State space and change point detection. Hidden Markov Models. Gaussian processes.

575.name: Advanced Machine Learning
575.description: Neural networks trained with backpropagation. Deep learning. Overfitting and underfitting. Active data acquisition. Hyperparameter optimization.

591.name: Capstone Project
591.description: A capstone design project designed to give students experience in leading complex multidisciplinary projects relevant to data science.
591.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     All of DSCI 513, DSCI 524, DSCI 525, DSCI 532, DSCI 541, DSCI 542, DSCI 554, DSCI 563, DSCI 573, DSCI 574, DSCI 575.

100.name: (De)coding Information and Why it Matters
100.description: Information and data as concepts and aspects of everyday experience. Creation, sharing, authorization, and valuing of information with implications for society. Critical perspectives and practices to engage with data, information, and technologies for personal productivity, scholarly inquiry, and civic engagement.

200.name: Foundations of Informatics
200.description: Theory, methods, and approaches for the analysis, design, and evaluation of information objects, activities, systems, and infrastructures in contemporary societies.

250.name: Networks, Crowds, and Communities
250.description: Introduces network concepts and methods for exploring social and organizational connectivity for work, socializing, and knowledge production. Examines impact of social media on connections that span space and place; peer production on authority structures; ubiquitous mobile connectivity on daily life.

300.name: Information and Data Design
300.description: Design of interactive information systems informed by human capabilities and behavior. Application of contemporary information design principles and practices to the conceptualization, creation, and testing of real-world prototypes of information objects and applications.

301.name: Digital Cultural Collections
301.description: Design, construction and critique of digital collections from a cultural informatics perspective.

303.name: Search Engines and Society
303.description: Aspects of technical implementation and societal impact of search engines. Explores how Google and other Internet search engines are powerful, global, and non-neutral tools that drive economies and shape our views of the world.

419.name: Information Visualization
419.description: Basic theory and practice required to visually represent information. Introduces design principles and practical skills to create effective information visualizations. Examines effect of different visual representations on understanding and meaning.

456.name: Information Policy and Society
456.description: Develops capabilities required to assess the need for information policies in professional contexts, evaluate relevant socio-technical dimensions and envision likely implications for specific communities and practice settings.
